title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
OB: When using code assist in a Java file, if there are no suggestions available, the file gets marked as dirty, indicating that a change has been made to the file.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not mark the file as dirty and indicate that a change has been made.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press Ctrl + Space to trigger code assist.
